meanings.definition: To send or pass on (a message, information, etc.)
meanings.sent1: She transmitted the news to her friend over the phone.
meanings.sent2: The radio transmitted the weather report to all the listeners.
meanings.sent3: He transmitted the secret code to his team using hand signals.
meanings.sent4: The teacher transmitted knowledge to her students like a beacon of light.
meanings.sent5: The internet transmitted the data across the globe in seconds.

meanings.definition: To spread or pass on (a disease, infection, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The mosquito transmitted the virus to the unsuspecting victim.
meanings.sent2: Coughing and sneezing can transmit germs to others easily.
meanings.sent3: The flu bug transmitted itself from one person to another in the crowded room.
meanings.sent4: Fear transmitted through the crowd like wildfire, causing panic.
meanings.sent5: The contaminated water transmitted illness to the entire village.

meanings.definition: To broadcast or relay (a signal, sound, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The radio tower transmitted the music to all the nearby cars.
meanings.sent2: The satellite transmitted the live feed of the event to viewers worldwide.
meanings.sent3: The loudspeaker transmitted the announcement across the entire campus.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse transmitted its warning signal to ships in the dark night.
meanings.sent5: The megaphone transmitted the coach's instructions to the players on the field.
